intro: Wikstroemia barbinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined wikstroemia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has simple, opposite leaves with a distinctive narrow venation pattern. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
